dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5594 IH: Protect Your PIN Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. McDonald Rivet (for herself, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Riley of New York, Mr. Ciscomani, Mr. Bacon, and Mr. Rutherford) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Violence Against Women Act Reauthorization Act of 2022 to include identity theft in the grant program related to local law enforcement grants for enforcement of cybercrimes, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect Your PIN Act of 2025.

section.header: Local law enforcement grants for enforcement of cybercrimes and identity theft
section.text: Section 1401 of the Violence Against Women Act Reauthorization Act of 2022 (34 U.S.C. 30107) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (4); and
by inserting after paragraph (2) the following:

paragraph.text: The term identity theft means a criminal offense applicable in the area under the jurisdiction of the relevant State, Indian Tribe, or unit of local government that involves knowingly transferring, possessing, or using, without lawful authority, a means of identification of another person.
in subsections (b) through (d), by inserting or identity theft after cybercrimes against individuals each place such term appears.
